prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. For the sketch, create a face and two loops on the X-Y plane. The first loop consists of four lines: * The first line starts at the origin (0.0,0.0) and ends at (0.75,0.0). * The second line starts at (0.75,0.0) and ends at (0.75,0.75). * The third line starts at (0.75,0.75) and ends at (0.0,0.75). * The fourth line starts at (0.0,0.75) and ends at the origin (0.0,0.0). The second loop consists of four lines as well: * The first line starts at (0.0556,0.0556) and ends at (0.6944,0.0556). * The second line starts at (0.6944,0.0556) and ends at (0.6944,0.6944). * The third line starts at (0.6944,0.6944) and ends at (0.0556,0.6944). * The fourth line starts at (0.0556,0.6944) and ends at (0.0556,0.0556). Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 for euler angles and (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) for the translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.6667 and no extrusion opposite the normal. The dimensions of this part are 0.75 units long, 0.75 units wide, and 0.6667 units high. **Intermediate Part 2** Construct a second three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector (0.0556,0.0556,0.0). For the sketch, create a face and one loop on the X-Y plane. This loop consists of four lines: * The first line starts at the origin (0.0,0.0) and ends at (0.6389,0.0). * The second line starts at (0.6389,0.0) and ends at (0.6389,0.6389). * The third line starts at (0.6389,0.6389) and ends at the origin (0.0,0.6389). * The fourth line starts at the origin (0.0,0.6389) and ends at the origin (0.0,0.0). Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6389. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 for euler angles and (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) for the translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal to generate the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0556 and no extrusion opposite the normal. The dimensions of this part are approximately 0.6389 units long, 0.6389 units wide, and 0.0556 units high.</description>
